speed_limits.notes: Urban limit often 30 km/h on single-lane one-way streets. No buffer on speed limits.

alcohol_limit.notes: 0.03% for novice drivers (<2 years) and professionals.

rules.child_seat_rules: Children <135cm must be in rear seats with approved system.
rules.phone_usage_rules: Handling phone is a serious offense (â‚¬200+). Using navigation while moving is banned.
rules.priority_rules: Give way to right. Roundabouts: Outside lane has priority to exit.

tolls.notes: Many 'Autopistas' (AP) are tolls. 'Autovias' (A) are generally free.

rules.parking_rules: Blue lines (Zona Azul) = Pay. Green lines = Residents usually. Yellow zig-zag = Tow away zone.
rules.winter_rules: Chains used in mountain areas when signed.

summary: Spain has excellent highways. Speed limits are strictly enforced by helicopters and drones. Be careful with parking zones in cities. Warning: Driving flip-flops or shirtless can be fined.
common_traps: Items on back shelf blocking view.
rental_and_idp_notes: IDP highly recommended for non-EU. Credit card mandatory for rentals.

regional_variations.notes: 'Madrid Central' (Zone of Low Emissions) - strict access bans for non-residents.
ZBE (Low Emission Zone) covers the whole city. Registration required for foreign cars.
